lead_paragraph: A criminal complaint alleges gross bribery to Brooklyn police precinct commanders by two businessmen who became big donors to a group allied with Mayor Bill de Blasio.

headline.print_headline: Favors at Fort Surrender: A Long History, but Perhaps a More Sordid Twist
headline.main: Favors at Fort Surrender: New Twist in History of Police and Borough Park

snippet: A criminal complaint alleges gross bribery to Brooklyn police precinct commanders by two businessmen who became big donors to a group allied with Mayor Bill de Blasio.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column examines history of relationships between elements of Brooklyn's ultra-Orthodox Jewish community and New York Police Dept commanders assigned to borough's precincts; holds current investigation into allegations of bribery by businessmen Jeremiah Reichberg and Jonas S Rechnitz, who also happen to be tied to political action group allied with Mayor Bill de Blasio, may well reveal one of city's more tangled and sordid political chapters.
